Our commuter stipend isn't large as some other SAAS companies ($40/month). Some people rely on public transportation to get to work each day - $40/month doesn't really cover that for 20 working days per month when transportation fees i.e. lyft, uber, Bart, Fastrak, parking etc continue to increase

headline: Great time to be at docusign
pros: Infectious dedication and passion for the companies vision and direction. Work/life balance and being able to create a schedule that works for individual employees is encouraged. A lot of communication between different levels and clear messaging for whats happening within the company.
cons: There really are no downsides that are exclusive to DocuSign culture.

headline: Great Company, Great Onboarding Experience, Great Training
pros:
I was recently hired at DocuSign and after 6 weeks, I'm still in awe of the onboarding experience.   The training is structured and well defined to include areas of DocuSign as a whole, the sales process (and what the agreement cloud is) and role specific training.  Never have I worked for a company that had such organization with such a consistent message.

The culture is really amazing too.  I knew that DocuSign did a lot for the community but they also do a lot for each other.  I haven't met a person yet that wasn't willing to step in and help out where needed or provide guidance when asked.
cons: Everything is great so far.

headline: Best Company I have work for!
pros: The management team truly cares about employees. Benefits are excellent. Work environment is fun and collaborative. I also love that DocuSign is generous in donating to great people and environmental causes.
cons: Lots of growth in business and number of employees can sometimes be challenging. But it's much better problem to have the alternative.

headline: Efficiency and Environment
pros: Great environment, work life and product!
cons: None that I can think of

headline: Awesome company
pros: Great company with a fantastic product that customers love. Leader in it's industry. Passion for innovation. Great culture with focus on diversity, good corporate citizenship. Good benefits package.
cons: Growing very fast, hard to find spaces for everyone - some employees asked to work from home until we get more space. Product innovation sometimes seems to go into too many directions.

headline: Hopefully something is done soon. Teetering on the Edge!
pros: I am really impressed with the people at DocuSign in general. I see infinite potential in them. A very smart group of people, that can do anything. The CEO is amazing, he genuinely listens and works hard. He's very passionate, personable, and smart. Comparatively speaking, the compensation and benefits are good. But could be better.
cons: Although the CEO is terrific, and most senior leaders are as well; there is some "dead weight" leaders & management that will spoil the bunch. Failure to take care of this, can cause mass exodus for good employees. Hopefully, you know which leaders / managers I speak of.

headline: Great place to work!
pros: great workspace, fantastic benefits, snacks/breakfast/beverages readily available, work/life balance equity
cons: compensation structure should be revisited with the ever growing quotas.

headline: Best company to work for
pros:
Work culture
Well-defined structure
Tons of benefits from medical to commuter benefits
Good Salary
cons: None in my opinion. It is one of the best company I have worked till now.

headline: Flexible work environment, smart coworkers
pros: Smart, articulate, and nice co-workers in a flexible, trusting, and supportive environment. Hard to beat that.
cons: Every company has some mess to deal with and DS is no different. New leadership trying to correct for some of this, but much of it is just structural.

headline: Great Company, Amazing People
pros:
People - Since joining I've yet to have any encounter that wasn't friendly and encouraging.  I honestly don't know how they've managed to bring together such amazing people.  It's a very social group which can be a bit intimidating for an introvert but the genuine acceptance and encouragement you'll receive from all your teammates will quickly get you past it.

Career Growth - You're always encouraged to keep learning and growing and the company is happy to invest in you to make sure that happens.

Extras - I can't speak for the company as a whole, but the office managers at our location go above and beyond to spoil everyone with snacks, lunches, and random events.  It's hard to work here and not feel appreciated.
cons: If your someone who just likes to work heads down without really interacting with people throughout the day, this might not be a great fit.

headline: A great growth company with all the positives that come with that and some of the pains
pros:
The people are fantastic top to bottom. The executive leadership has great vision for where they plan to take the company. Management and peers alike are extremely talented. Feedback culture is strong and everyone I've worked with has been very accessible. Peers help with learning, managers are supportive.
With being a growth company, there's tremendous opportunity for career growth. Roles are being created and teams are growing to support the book of business.
cons: They need more people. Many business units seem lean, supported by a few veterans with lots of experience doing everything they can to bring new faces up to speed. DocuSign is investing in people and hiring in droves, but we're just not quite there yet. Training has improved immensely but there's still a gap.

headline: Mixed results
pros:
- Recognizable brand and considered a market leader
- High-growth industry
- Ideal stepping stone to further your career elsewhere
- C-staff seem like they are saying and doing the right things
cons:
- Too much bureaucracy/politics in the middle layers, so managers aren't empowered to do the right thing for the company and their direct reports.  The competent go-getters who can deliver consistently aren't rewarded,  because promotions are popularity contests.  
- Lack of investment/resourcing and career development for high-potential people, who can make an impact to the organization.  If you want to be promoted, you have to leave DocuSign.
- Unclear roles and responsibilities
- Lack of accountability.... incompetent people can skate by and take credit for other people's work.  It's ok if incompetent people ignore the go-getters, but if the go-getters ignore them, they complain.  Two great examples are Product Marketing and INTL marketing teams, who have no measurable impact but complain the loudest and create more work for other teams.

headline: Overall positive
pros: Great opportunity for growth within the company
cons: Management could be better in training employees for success

headline: Competitive Product, Great Culture
pros: Culture, compensation, career development / challenge
cons: None that I can think of right now!

headline: Great opportunities to learn
pros: Very good opportunity to learn about sales process and product. People are easily accessible and always open to discussion.
cons: Cooperation could be improved, perhaps.

headline: Great Place to Learn and Grow
pros:
It is a great time to jump on board. DocuSign is a relatively young company (business process) having just gone public about a year ago. The company is moving beyond the "startup culture" and towards a more mature corporate structure. The benefit of this is that as business processes start to mature, there are a lot of opportunities to build something new and take ownership of what you create. I believe that my team has strong leadership that empowers its team members to have personal growth and remain challenged every day. 

As far as the benefits go, the work-life balance is great. If you are into volunteering, the company allows you to take a certain number of paid hours to go volunteer during work and has a ton of options available for you to choose from.
cons: The product has been changing rapidly over the last few months with new features and services to learn. This isn't particularly bad, but requires a bit of effort to keep up with the pace at which the company is changing.

headline: Great Place to Work
pros: Excellent culture, growth opportunities, competitive benefits, work/life balance, great product offering
cons: Rapid growth sometimes leads to clunky process and roll-outs, but because this stems from advancement, this is a good problem to have.

headline: Great Company to Work For
pros:
Great working environment
Entire company feels like one big team
Great benefits
Industry standard
Fun place to work
Worldwide brand recognition
cons: Haven't found any yet, but I keep looking.

headline: An amazing place  to work for!
pros:
Great product, great values and amazing benefits. 
Folks are super nice and always willing to help.
cons: Some growing pains around processes.

headline: Collaborative Teamwork
pros: Supportive, collaborative, inviting workplace environment. Extremely supportive and understanding management that wants employees to succeed in personal and career aspects.
cons: Nothing to report for a con

headline: Great onboarding experience
pros:
I've been here for two weeks so far, and feel very welcomed. I'm impressed by how empowered and empowering people are at DocuSign. As a new employee, I've gotten plenty of direction along with a lot of space for learning through experience and experimentation without fear of looking bad or making mistakes. 

I am incredibly impressed by Docusign's IT team. They are very efficient and friendly, which made computer set up incredibly easy. Knowing that they are available made onboarding a lot less stressful than my past experiences.
cons: None so far! Still on the honeymoon.

headline: Fun and wonderful vibe!
pros: The culture and vibe that the workplace services team creates for the employees is top notch! The happy hours, social events, snacks and services makes for a fun and social environment in the office. Keep up the good work!
cons:
The collaboration between teams is still lacking.  Also, recognition needs to be widespread to other business units, other than sales and engineering. Sometimes saying "great job" to support teams can go a long way.

Work life balance can sometimes be challenging. Resources in my org are lacking, which makes for longer days and sometimes interrupted vacations.

headline: Great place to work
pros:
Awesome Team mates
Flexible hours with work from home options 
Working Managers who are subject matter experts
cons: Some  team structures can benefit from realignment.

headline: Great Place to work- Hard to keep up with all the opportunity
pros:
DocuSign continues to be a dynamic and ever changing and ever growing place to work.  When I started, we were pre-IPO and there were some concerns that as the dust settled from going public that opportunities would slow down and growth would be more stead.  NOT SO!  There is so much opportunity on the sales side and I imagine everywhere in the org for growth within your career, and to make moves that might have been harder to do previously. 

Great culture- team dynamics are great, events are fun and you truly want to be there,
Great resources- amazing amount of resources both in terms of training and just the ability to reach out to just about anyone about something and they really want to help
cons:
I think that with many tech companies you need to be able to handle a lot of ambiguity and fast changes but its not hectic and chaotic to the point where things dont work.  

The company is growing so harder to know everyone but core teams are getting more cohesive and close .

headline: Overall good company, although they require employees to share rooms...
pros: DocuSign offers good benefits, compensation, good culture,  great work-life balance.
cons: They require employees to share hotel rooms.

headline: Great company with a lot of potential but hastily implemented processes are slowing us down
pros: The people are still the best part of DocuSign but the environment is becoming more cutthroat as people feel they have to steal work from peers to survive.
cons: Lots of pressure, fear of losing job, too many middle managers are making new processes to justify their existence.

headline: Best Company I've Ever Worked For
pros:
-CEO has clear communication and is approachable 
-Always innovating and adding new technology 
-Room for promotions come around about once a year
-Pay is solid
-Quotas are attainable
-WFH available 1 day per/wk
cons: -Team leaders are starting to get a little green

headline: Lack of racial diversity
pros: Good pay and snacks. They also provide you with Volunteer Time Off so you can get out and help the community.
cons: Not many black people work at this company.

headline: Great Company to Work For!!
pros:
1. Really strong company culture.
2. Amazing coworkers. When you need help with something, there is an "all hands on deck" attitude as opposed to a "not my job" attitude.
cons: It is very difficult to get any DocuSign swag unless you and 75 of your closest friends want to order the same shirt.

headline: Great Company, Better People
pros:
They hire people that have similar personalities which make team events and time at the office more enjoyable.

Good blend of grinding through the week but also fun sales competitions through the months.

Management is very reasonable and are rooting for your success as an SDR
cons: Pay compensation for SDR is good but not as good as some other entry level tech sales jobs in Seattle.

headline: LOVE working at DocuSign!
pros:
*The office environment is extremely positive and collaborative. Open floor plan allows for an energizing space to work
*Executive Leadership genuinely cares about employee feedback. Feedback is noted and changes are made accordingly. 
*Opportunity for growth: there are a multitude of opportunities to interact with other divisions outside of your own; including mentor events, all hands meetings, and happy hours.
cons:
*Commuter benefits could be higher
*Lack of gym stipend

headline: Great place to grow your career
pros: Fast growth, good benefits, friendly employees, lots of office locations, engaged executive staff, people like the product
cons: Fast growth, legacy technical issues

headline: Great Opportunities at DocuSign
pros:
Fast paced but exciting place to work! Great Opportunities for growth and top quality training via our learning lab.

Great office environment with all the catering and facilities that look to rival other tech firms.
cons: It very face paced as the company grows and I think alittle too US focused at this moment in time.

headline: Great Company! Great Direction
pros: In a great space, lots of opportunity. Product can be sold to so many organizations, great culture!
cons: They don’t reimburse us for our gym membership yet.

headline: Sales
pros:
Great enablement program to get staff  GTM fast
HR taking feedbacks proactively and actually actions on it!
cons: - none that causes major concerns as feedbacks are seriously taken and reviewed.

headline: Great!
pros: Incredible environment with people who want to see you succeed!
cons: No complaints at all. Love it here!

headline: Work of my life
pros: DocuSign hits the trifecta: great team, great product and great work. The environment is open, positive and focused on generating outcomes for our customers. With the company growing so quickly, there is a lot to do. This is rewarding and engaging.
cons: Pace rarely lets up so you have to look after yourself.

headline: Incredible company
pros: Incredible culture, great people, challenging work.
cons: Let's get some catered lunch

headline: Love this place
pros:
Flexibility 
Culture
Fastpaced
Work from Home  options 
Stock Options
cons:
Hard to move departments
Shift bids
Consistency between managers
None
Nothing

headline: Associate
pros: Growing company; relaxed working environment, friendly staffs
cons: Long hours sometimes during earnings

headline: Great Company
pros: Great culture and continuing to evolve way beyond what people know us for
cons: Not much to say here

headline: Outstanding place to work
pros: Outstanding company to work for! Great company culture, Management team, company vision, career development opportunities, customers, rewards, benefits, offices.
cons: So far I made no negative experienced at DocuSign

headline: Great place to work with great benefits!
pros: So much potential to do important work and have your voice heard by leadership. There are a lot of opportunities to grow within your career if you put the effort in. A lot of autonomy and little micromanaging so far. Benefits are really great (the only things that would make them better would be unlimited PTO and free lunch), salary is fair and equity is generous. If you have a good manager and team, the possibilities are huge with how you can grow your career and impact on the company!
cons: Internal communication and collaboration is a challenge. With so many teams doing very similar work, sometimes you'll find that others are doing similar work to you and figuring out overlap can be difficult. Additionally, it's hard to move quickly because there are often many cooks in the kitchen. However, Leadership is aware of this and has communicated dedication to figuring it out this year.

headline: Great Entry Level Opportunity
pros:
-amazing for post-college or transitioning into sales from another company/industry
-perks: health benefits, transportation stipend, snacks, food and drinks stocked in the kitchen on each floor (super helpful), lots of happy hours, team events, networking
-if you want to grow with the company and see a position you're aiming for, talk to your manager. the company wants to hire from within. 
-hardworking and metric driven environment, but also very fun and you won't feel micro-managed
cons:
-great perks and benefits=low pay (compared to SDR roles elsewhere)
-the SDR team is basically a post UW co-ed frat (not my thing, but it's great if its yours)
-i personally love not being micro-managed and having the freedom to do what i need for my own success, but there are times when our managers get super busy and are no where to be found

headline: Great company with some "bad apple" leaders mixed in
pros:
- Great culture with clean and semi-modern offices
- Company continues to improve on employee offerings such as paid leave, matching 401k, and other things
- Good product that customers know and love making this a safe and stable company to work for.
cons:
- Some "Bad Apple" leadership positions can ruin the experience for employees stuck under those individuals.
- "Good ol Boy" mentality is still present where a lot of recognition and benefits are given to people based on personal relationships vs merit or earned
- Diversity is so bad it's almost a joke?  While it's common for people to complain these days, you can't deny that the executive leadership is almost entirely white males.  Company wide events are also very heavily white.  This company is primarily west coast US, which limits options.
- Product teams seem a bit out-of-touch with the rest of the company, making it a frustrating place to work for customer-facing roles at times.
- Recognition is typically only given tot hose with outstanding "lucky" performance via large deals won and Presidents Club style events are awarded on a "Good-ol-Boy" basis vs strict rules for attainment.

headline: Great people & Great company!
pros: I truly love working for DocuSign. It has been an excellent experience so far. The people are great, the product is great, and the company treats us well. We are expanding extremely quickly so I hope we are able to maintain our current sense of culture, identity & work life balance.
cons: I do not have any complaints. The biggest employee ask was matching 401k which we received this year.

headline: Amazing work place
pros:
* Great management team; open minded and available for employees from all levels
* Horizontal organizational chart; everyone is in charge of their own stuff
* People around you are trying to help you grow and to make the company succeed
* Excellent work/life balance. Nobody will notice if you arrive late/leave early or if you have a doctor's appointment as long as you deliver results.
cons: Engineering teams in Seattle and SF have been known to have some friction.

headline: Value's Lacking
pros:
- Hungry and talented employees
- Good people, for the most part
- Promotion opportunities (when actually given to people who earned it)
cons:
- Leadership is out for themselves and their priorities, upper leadership brought in pre ipo (for their own agendas/or friends agendas)
- Many leaders do not advocate for their teams
- Lack of transparency 
- Internal surveys that "encourage" transparency, which is then held against departments with low scores/bad feedback
- Fear tactics encourage employees not to speak up 
- Compensation is low across most functions

headline: Top notch software company
pros:
1.  Onboarding - they take this seriously and it shows.  Everyone invests the time to go to a central location to meet new hires, learn about the products, experience the culture, and team build through community service.

2.  Work balance - hours are reasonable and flexible.  I am able to drop off the kids, get into the office a bit later, leave a bit early to pick up the kids, then get back online at night for an hour or two to catch up.

3.  Amenities - there's lots of snacks and food if you don't have time to go out to eat.  It's not a full on cafeteria, though they frequently have events with food, but you can easily make a sandwich if you have back to back meetings.

4.  Work tools - the laptops are decent quality and they have a variety of tools available to do your job.  I've worked at places where the tools are subpar and it's a pain to do the simplest tasks like submit an expense.
cons:
1.  Growing pains - there is some chaos but expected for a growing company.  Consistency is not there yet in terms of how things get done.  Some people are bothered by this but I happen to prefer it because it's an opportunity to do the work yourself.

2.  Work tools - while the tools are great, there are too many of them.  It would be better to standardize on a subset to minimize all the variations that lead to inefficiencies.

headline: Great autonomy and best product
pros:
The product is really strong and it is the best time to be working in the EMEA market.
Fast paced environment, it never gets boring. Best atmosphere and culture of reward and recognition.
Feedbacks are always wanted and taken into account.
cons: Some processes that are implemented might not be the best but change is always possible!

headline: Great company to work for!
pros: Great coworkers, great environment, 401k matching, espp, often free food, helpful management
cons: lack of gym benefit

headline: Great work environment.
pros: Work life balance is great.
cons: I do now have any at this time.

headline: mixed feelings
pros: I've got to hand it to our PR team - having someone actively read and respond to Glassdoor reviews is a great way to ensure our ratings are high. It's unfortunate that that alone is not enough to attract and retain talent. We do have very reasonable work-life balance, somewhat decent career mobility, and it's incredibly difficult to get fired. So if you are a consistent B player seeking a place with job security - you've come to the right place!
cons: Some serious house cleaning is needed in engineering - our organization is bureaucratic, ambiguous, process-heavy, and highly ineffective. This prevents us from being innovative, disruptive, and high performant - and we surely won't be able to attract or retain top talent. The pay is also another huge problem, you have to be willing to pay for and retain A players! Every year I always see our top talent leave for better offers while B players continue to stick around.

headline: Great Product- Poor Management
pros:
DocuSign Product is the best in class and keeps getting better
most of the people are great to work with
Great location, great benefits
cons:
Management in some departments are sorely lacking in helping their direct reports succeed. 
Current positions could change with the drop of a hat and a career direction you were headed in may no longer be through the position you took.
To be considered for promotions into roles you would succeed at, be prepared to have to spend your nights going to the bar or karaoke with people you may not like to be "Friends" with them.

headline: DocuSign Review
pros: They offer competitive packages for new employees, transportaion stipend, a plethora of healthy snacks at work, free insurance for employees, meaningful impact goals for the environment, lots of office socials, they offer an education stipend and offer many in office career development opportunities/classes. Most people seem to get in around 9am and leave at 5:30 or 6pm. Work life balance seems good.
cons: They don't offer full meals like many other tech companies do, no gym membership incentives, I've heard its hard to get competitive pay raises for internal promotions, they are not big on working from home and prefer employees to work from the office, they need an office enviormental update as the spaces are very white, I wish we could brings dogs to work. The office is divided by floors so its hard to meet others in different departments.

headline: Amazing benefits, indicative of a great culture
pros: Great benefits like generous Parental Leave (for either parent) and Volunteer Time Off show that DocuSign is willing to put their money where their mouth is and promote a positive, personal-life-friendly culture.
cons: Still have some way to go with diversity, specifically around hiring practices/interviews, but I do believe they are genuinely open to the feedback which is rare.

headline: Awesome Place to Work
pros: This is a really awesome place to work, where your colleagues care about you, and always aim to be in an happy environment. The development plan really works here, and the employees have the chance to build a solid career inside the company.
cons: Health plan it's not equal for higher positions and lower positions in the company.

headline: My First 2 Weeks @ DocuSign!
pros:
The on boarding process at DocuSign was tremendous! I went through 3 stages of interviews. The 1st being a phone interview which lasted about 30 mins. Then was the virtual interview through HireVue asked 5 questions and took about 15 mins. Then within a few days I was interviewing at the Seattle office. The interview took about an hour and was with 3 sales managers. After the interview we took a tour and was told i would hear back in a few days. They let me know the next morning that i was hired. That whole process only took a week! 

Then came Discovering DocuSign, the week long on boarding training. Here, i met people from various offices and countries. In that week we took part in Sales Boot Camp where you are trained on the product, sales methodologies and the DocuSign way. This week was fun and educational, and the next week followed with more training. 

The 1st week in the office was full of learning, networking and career building. DocuSign spends so  much time ensuring you are prepared and equipped with the tools needed to succeed. I have enjoyed every minute of my employment at DocuSign and am excited to start my career here.
cons: None so far. I have loved everything DocuSign has to offer.

headline: Account Executive
pros:
Market leader in a niche application
Good place to move into your first sales role
cons:
Woefully under skilled managers, with next to no leadership training or skills.
Culture is non-existent.
More people miss targets than achieve them
Lot of travel
Very much a top down approach to managing

headline: All the things
pros:
I can't rate the experience I've had highly enough. Best time of my life, and (hopefully) work of my career.

- Sincere execution of every corporate best practice I can think of
- Takes excellent care of staff
- Outstanding recognition and gratitude-based culture
- Generous benefits and compensation
- Positive and forward-leaning vision with committed leadership
- Open to change, personal initiative and growth of employees
- Design team growing and developing along several maturity measures
cons:
- Multiple levels of management dilutes goals  & directives
- Longevity of business results in a few sacred cows
- Pockets of "not invented here" syndrome, bunch of legacy tech-stacks
- Growth-stage post IPO results in some growing pains

headline: Doing the best work of my career
pros:
Working with like minded people in a collaborate envoirnment. 
Being part of  a journey of  growth and expansion.
Career and personal development.
Success and hard work is rewarded.
Its Fun...we laugh alot
cons: The Fridges do nothing to help my Diet Coke addiction

headline: Great work environment and company culture
pros:
-Company culture is second to none.  Very supportive environment that values continuous learning and career development.
-Great company outlook.  
-Good Benefits (401K match, ESPP, Health, Vision,, 4 weeks PTO to start, educational assistance program, 3 paid volunteer days, etc.)
-Best product by far in the marketplace.
-DocuSign as a company fully invests in their employees happiness and development.
cons:
-General growing pains in integrating new products and platform extensions.  
-Inter-team communication is an ongoing effort.

headline: The best culture, and the leadership cares.
pros: The benefits are fantastic, it's a second family instead of co-workers. Politics are kept away and the environment is friendly. The opportunity to grow within the company.
cons: At the moment there isn't one.

headline: Great Company, Good Cultures and Cares about Environment & Employees
pros:
- Smart, nice, hardworking coworkers who genuinely care about doing the right thing
- Everyone is very helpful
- Great culture
- Benefits package is excellent
- More than most any other company I have worked for, you really get the sense that DS and the execs really care about the people that work here.  They want them happy and healthy and productive.  
-Workplace services (in SF) is always doing fun little parties, bringing in vendors (like Ritual coffee, a smoothie place and this amazing yogurt company) 
- DS IMPACT - they the volunteering and contributing to charity very seriously.  The company just made a huge contribution to Jane Goodall Foundation
- I can genuinely say I am proud to work at this company
cons: - Large centralized support infrastructure (Finance, Sales Ops) so sometimes it is hard to figure out who supports the specific function you are interested in.  Really not that big a con I just ask a few people and usually find my way to the correct person.

headline: Recruiter
pros:
Collaborative culture
Growth is extremely fast which will create career avenues 
Great product
Business is very environmentally aware
Great leaders in the business who really care and listen 
Development and supported study opportunities
cons: Be prepared to work hard. The fact the business is growing so rapidly means you will have to roll up your sleeves and be involved with tasks above or below your level

headline: Great place to work!
pros: Free food amenities, flexible work from home time, paid volunteer days.
cons: Some of the compensation needs to be increased

headline: Great place to work
pros:
- always busy
- great work environment
- room for growth
- management that listens to feedback and adjusts accordingly
- Large scale company with small-size feel
- Selling high quality product
cons: - Compensation (base) could be higher as it is lower than competitors

headline: The best place I have ever worked-- and it keeps getting better
pros:
- The CEO is absolutely amazing. He is so charismatic, caring, down to earth, and personable. 
- The work that we are doing is really fun. There are so many new initiatives and exciting developments. Great time to be at this company.
- The perks are pretty good now. The committee that deals with the snacks and company events are so amazing. They host events that are so cute and they really show that they care about us. They always take suggestions for snack options, and are open to feedback, and actually act on that feedback.
- The team here is super passionate and highly motivated, and is fun to work with them
cons:
- The company is not mobile first
- I wish they provided lunch every day

headline: Great company and great place to work!
pros:
It is great to work in marketing for a product that has an amazing product- market fit and is loved by our customers.  We can focus on continuing to innovate and lead the market.

The marketing team is incredibly smart and keeps me challenged and learning more every day. People work hard but there is good work/life balance as well.

The CEO and leadership team have a great vision and set a clear direction for where we are going as a company. 

Benefits are generous but most important is that the company and the leadership 'walk the talk' in creating a company that gives back to our community. We get 3 paid volunteer days per year, matching donations and the product is literally saving the forests.  They also make it fun day to day with lots of fun employee events.
cons: I really do not have any cons.

headline: The First Corporate job I’ve Ever Loved!
pros:
DocuSigns “business owner” mentality really enables employees to work in a manner that best suits them.
The lack of micromanaging is very refreshing.
Every manager I’ve met from the CEO to my first line manager has been positive, supportive and very available.
cons: Like drinking from a firehose.  There is a ton of information coming at us everyday.  It’s a dramatically changing company and things move quick.

headline: If you like challenging and rewarding work, DocuSign is the place for you.
pros:
Customers love DocuSign, there is a constant flow of incoming opportunities and still plenty to come!

They do a good job of picking smart and talented people with diverse backgrounds so everyone has something to teach you

Pay is good, it can always be better but it's better than most here

Opportunity for career growth and promotion is abundant within the company

Constant events/parties/celebrations going on

Lots of food, snacks, drinks and comfortable atmospheric elements to enjoy in the office
cons: Typical growing pains. Lots of constant change. Nothing unmanageable or unexpected but if I take a week off it feels like I missed a whole month but it only takes a day or two to catch up.

headline: Great place to work!
pros:
- Great Team Culture
- Great Snacks
- Great salary and compensation plan
- Amazing to network, a lot of people from a lot of backgrounds work in Sales or related fields
cons: no real cons so far, great company with a great culture. everyone knows eachother in the Dublin office

headline: Opportunities to Contribute at all levels
pros: Dynamic and engaging groups to work with that provide continuous opportunities to those who succeed.  All are engaged in reaching the company goals as well in helping you to achieve your own personal career goals.  The transparency and accountability of upper management sets the tone for the whole company.
cons: Migrating from a one product company to a multi-product company has its growing pains but management is willing and able to help plod the course and get in the trenches and do the hard work when needed.

headline: Couldn't be happier
pros:
Amazing team & culture
Great perks - food, drink, parties, etc.
Love the product 
Given the resources to succeed
cons:
Too many options in the kitchen
Too much fun at the parties

headline: Truly a great place to work
pros:
Leadership listens and takes action because they genuinely want to make the company the best it can be for both it's customers and it's employees. 
In a customer facing role, you want a product you can lean on, DocuSign is that product.
I can't speak for all managers, but my manager is the best I've ever had and truly has my best interest at heart.
Great opportunities to grow your career if you are willing to put in the work and speak up to let your managers know your goals. Nothing will be handed to you but it is there if you want it.
Culture is top notch, people love working here.
cons: No cons that are specific to DocuSign. Sales can be demanding and tough, but that is the case anywhere you work, in my opinion.

headline: Great culture and supportive team
pros:
- Career progression 
- Work/life balance 
- Adding more benefits like 401k 
- Stock Employee Purchase Plan
- Great location - easy to commute to
- Pretty laid back environment
- Management cares about your success and provides support
cons:
- Still working on some processes and sometimes not clear how to get things done
- Interview process can be unclear for new hires (not sure what team you are actually applying for), but on the positive side they take culture fit seriously so they have you interview with multiple teams.

headline: Great place to work
pros: DocuSign has been a great place to work! The overall culture/atmosphere is positive and makes coming to work each day not feel like a drag. Great coworkers, great perks to the job (health insurance, 401k, commuter benefits, cell phone reimbursement, gym subsidy - coming in the future) and snacks! Plus the ability to work from home when needed and a great work-life balance!
cons: Customer Success Org has a bit of disorganization as the team is fairly new and still going through some growing pains but nothing terrible.

headline: Great Sales Culture
pros: DocuSign brings all the benefits and value of working for a big company all the while maintaining the culture and nimbleness of a mid sized company.  Upper Management is committed to sales and the sales force. After working in a very large well respected sales organization, the ability to do whatever it takes to win business is a nice change
cons: Still finding some growing pains as they move from a small  company to a large  company.  Some challenges with new product integration, but those are being addressed in the short term....

headline: Excellent first impression from new hire
pros: I have never before worked with a company with such a clear vision of direction, including clarity on how they intend to get there.  It is hard not to be inspired by the outlook of the company and its fantastic employees.  Upper management is very accessible.  As a new hire about a month in, I have already had several casual (and comfortable) conversations with a few C-levels (including the CEO); they really are in touch with their employees at all levels of the organization.  No ivory tower syndrome that I have seen elsewhere.  Docusign treats employees very well, with great perks and flexibility (which might vary by department).  Every day I come to work, I'm eager and motivated to play my role in building excellent software that really makes a difference for our clients.
cons: They are hiring a lot right now.  The onboarding process is a bit overburdened.  It took longer than expected to get up and running with hardware and software.  However, the format new hire orientations and bootcamps have been fantastic.

headline: Amazing brand backed by a legitimately amazing culture
pros:
DocuSign has a great brand.  Whenever I talk with someone about where I work, inevitably they say something like, "DocuSign?  Oh yeah, I love DocuSign, we just used it when we bought our house....".  While this is indicative of a great product that solves a global need to reduce paper, improve processes, and make doing business easier, it doesn't stop there.  

The DocuSign brand is backed by a culture of transparency, collaboration, customer focus, inclusiveness, and dedication to employee success.  Beginning with the recruiting process all the way through on boarding, the experience was simply terrific.  Some key highlights:

- Responsiveness from the recruiter.  I was always informed of the process, next steps, timelines, etc.

- An on boarding process that is second to none.  From company processes all the way through continued training and education opportunities to keep pace with career development.

- A compassionate, super capable, and transparent leadership team.  From the C-Suite down to first line management, there is a coordinated effort to drive communication, direction, and strategy which keeps all employees focused on the right things.

- It's a culture of collaboration.  There are efficient, defined ways to share best practices, wins, lessons learned, and ways to ask questions and get quick guidance.  Everyone is always willing to help out - across all departments.

- Compensation and benefits are top notch and I feel well taken care of.

- Work life balance is very fair.  Depending on your role, there can be peaks and valleys with work levels, but there is always an expectation that you take care of yourself when needed.  Generous PTO helps here as well.  And if there are "valleys" in the work load, there are ample opportunities to join in on special projects that help the company improve or to develop new programs and/or content.
cons: I honestly don't have anything to share in terms of Cons.  It is a growing, fast paced company with a clearly defined direction.  So, there is a lot to do and everyone is pulling together to meet the challenge.  So, it is not a sit back and coast environment if that is your thing.

headline: Best place to work!
pros:
-Product is amazing. 
-Smart people in all departments. 
-Software sells it's self.
-Always stocked healthy snacks.
-Great team outings.
cons: -Change is constant, can be difficult to stay up to date on all the movement.

headline: Great place to work, if a bit slow
pros:
Friendly, generally collaborative culture
Classic, scaling enterprise SaaS
Low travel between Seattle and San Francisco
Good opportunity ahead of the company
cons:
Product development and innovation is slow, sometimes glacial
Recent re-orgs have upset the apple cart - good for the long term, though

headline: Good Company - Can be burnt out
pros:
fun enviorment
good atmosphere
great training - they really do have constant meetings on new methods and features of the business.
cons: SDR management can be big  hit and miss, some managers will go to bat for you, and are amazing. others should not be in the position as they have little interest in their job and like to let their employees bear the brunt of that.

headline: Such a fulfilling career
pros: Company culture,  compensation, benefits, executive team is awesome and really cares, great product
cons: DocuSign retained its startup culture after the IPO, if you're into a more uptight culture it might not be your fit

headline: Great software company
pros:
CEO and leadership
Training programs
Cool office, good snacks
Stock options, recent IPO
Reputation and brand recognition
cons: Lack of clarity on upward mobility process within sales

headline: Sales
pros: Great culture, great company, great people
cons: Nothing significant stands out, it is a great place to work

headline: Director - Customer Success (EMEA)
pros:
DocuSign  offers a class leading System of Agreement platform to enable customers to improve efficiency and profitability.
Great people to work with, lots of energy and focus.
cons: Very Busy, all of the time, if you consider that as a con!

headline: Account Executive
pros:
- Challenging role
- Great team
- Great Salary and benefit packages
cons: If you do not seek challenges, DocuSign is probably the wrong place for you to work. However, you do get all the help you need to over come those challenges with a very strong team.

headline: Software Engineer
pros:
- Good work life balance
- Company trips
cons: - Base Salary is low but stock options, following the IPO are pretty good

headline: A wonderful place to grow and learn
pros:
Great co-workers  -- ambitious, smart and eager to collaborate 
Great product -- people love it and it feels great to promote a product that's helping eliminate paper and save trees! 
Hyper growth -- the company has been and continues to grow at a hyper-fast rate, which means there are super fun challenges to work on and lots of opportunity for career progression
cons: With such high growth, some times red tape slows things down. But eliminating some of the friction is a high priority for the company leadership and we've seen a lot of progress.

headline: Lack of diversity and compassion
pros: Generous with salaries, work/life balance and snacks. Autonomy with workload,
cons:
I was made to sit completely by myself for almost a year and a half, away from my team, with days of no conversation. My manager only communicated via email and my boss actively blanked me. I was referred to as "him" in meetings, if acknowledged at all. 

For a week, the lighting above my desk area was broken and I ended up sat (alone) in darkness. When the light started making a clicking noise, I raised it only to be told: "If we can't freeze you out, we'll just drive you insane." 

After working on Momentum, the company's annual event, with my contribution actively supporting record attendance, the team went to drinks without me while I was in the bathroom without a word. 

When I asked for a raise in line with market rate and headhunters, I was told it was too late before my current contract expired. I had been given my new contract to sign only 2hrs before. (I got the money I asked for at my new job, needless to say.) 

The office is cliquey and I think it's fair to say there is a degree of latent homophobia. 
It is not a company for creative people, or for anyone who wants more out of life than SQLs.

headline: Senior Director
pros:
Best solution offering in its class.
Our people care.
Company delivers on its promises to customers and employees.
cons: Company is growing fast.  Its a high-pressure environment, requires high performance, not for the squeamish.

headline: Marketing
pros: great CEO, great benefits, great snacks
cons: bad pay, bad communication, bad team alignment

headline: Almost Perfect
pros:
DocuSign is a great company and in many ways it is exceptional. The C level leadership is outstanding and Dan Springer is a talented, effective, and personable CEO. He continues to make good on his promises and is leading DocuSign to even bigger and better things. 

The salary and benefits are competitive and the office environment has the perks you expect at a high-tech company in San Francisco.

The IMPACT program is a shining star at DocuSign. It encourages and supports employees to give back to their communities and charitable organizations.
cons: Even the best companies hire managers who have their own agenda that is not consistent with the best interests of the company nor its employees.  Unfortunately this happened to my organization. What was once a highly functioning, collaborative and effective team, is slowly being dismantled by a new senior manager in a larger organization that relies on downward communication and offers no opportunity to communicate up in a safe way.

headline: Incredible First Job
pros:
I worked as an intern last summer and came on full-time this year. Though I have less than a year of experience to go off of, I can say with no doubt in my mind that this was the right place for me to start my career. It's a great place to grow and learn.

Within engineering, I have had the privilege of being mentored and getting to work with some extremely bright people. Every conversation I have furthers my career and my ability to contribute as much as possible. On top of the incredible people the benefits are generous. DocuSign really cares about it's employees.
cons: The compensation is on the lower end of the current market for engineers, especially in Seattle, but DoucSign is still growing and I think this is getting better from what I've heard. Other than that, no cons.

headline: It really is one of the "best places to work"
pros: This is by far one of the best work environments I have been a part of.  The developers here are the most non-judgmental, helpful people I have ever met.  Everyone is willing to explain and teach when needed.  Work/life balance is amazing, as well as compensation.  Benefits are comparable to other companies.  There are plenty of opportunities for growth and moving up.
cons: It is difficult to find a con honestly.  I have worked at many places and this is the most enjoyable environment I have seen.  I really enjoy coming to work everyday.

headline: One of my Best Professional Experiences
pros:
I can't say enough about how great the people are whom I work with. When I was new, they reached out to make sure I had the help that I needed, and they made it explicit that you will not be made to feel bad asking questions.

The office is incredibly friendly and fun. Every day at lunch, there is usually a game or 2 going on that you can easily join in on. Regular lunches and office happy hours give you plenty of opportunity to get to know your co-workers in a more personal setting.

The work is challenging, but management sets entirely reasonable expectations. I have been given enough creative liberty to come up with solutions to the problems.

I hope this doesn't sound too cliched, but the leadership is truly inspiring. Talking with them about future plans for our office and for the company make me want to help bring them to fruition.
cons:
My chief complaint is that our office currently does not have an opening for me to refer a former co-worker to.

Other than that, I have no cons. I legitimately look forward to going to work every morning.

headline: Fantastic plan to work!
pros:
- Excellent culture / team environment
 - Great energy
 - Exceptional CEO and leadership team
- Innovative / forward thinking company - constant product, business, process enhancements
- Flexible working environment 
- A company that really looks after it's employees and offers fantastic benefits and opportunities

I would recommend DocuSign to anyone!
cons: - Growing pains of a hyper growth company. We have out grown our office space but it's a good problem to have and we will be moving in to fantastic new offices soon!

headline: Customer Support Representative
pros: Amazing Coworkers, Amazing Product, I have never been to a company that had such an amazing culture!
cons: Change Change Change in the time I have been here things are constantly changing which doesn't bother me but to some can be hard.

headline: Software Developer Intern
pros: Great company to work for with outstanding culture.
cons: No cons, I had an amazing experience during the internship.

headline: Market Development Rep
pros:
The People- I have never been around so many people with such a high level of EQ in my life.  It makes for a fun atmosphere on the Market Development/Sales Development floor.  The team comes from super diverse types of work experience as well...which makes for interesting and engaging conversations with co-workers.  Some people come from sales roles at other companies...but it seems that managers are willing to take a risk on "less traditional" backgrounds (i.e. military, technical program management, service industry, education, etc.)

The Product- Should go without saying but it is much easier to sell a product you genuinely beleive can add value for your prospect.  A+ on that front.

Collaborative Sales Culture- Everyone has their own number to hit for sure-- but people are very willing to share best practices across the team, what has worked/not worked for them, etc.

Pay- Pay seems fair, uncapped commission

Work/Life Balance- legitimate 40 hour weeks: no expectation to go over that, in fact it is actually discouraged.
cons: Honestly was tough to come up with a con.  I would say the benefits overall are great but a gym stipend/reimbursement would be nice to have.

headline: Love it Here
pros:
- Amazing Benefits
- Great Team Environment
- 20 Days PTO
- Free snacks/food
- Growth Potential/Promotion Opportunities
cons: Wish there was a better commuter benefit and that there was a gym/fitness benefit

headline: Account Executive
pros: Great product, constantly innovating and genuinely helping businesses transact faster and more efficiently.
cons: Fast growth so new employees need to get onboard and get up to speed quickly.

headline: DocuSign Review
pros: Great benefits and good work-life balance
cons: Communication between upper management and the teams that do the work is not always the best

headline: Best place I've worked at!!
pros:
I cannot say enough good things about DocuSign. From the on-boarding process to departmental training, it has been a positive and professional experience through-and-through. At DocuSign, not only do I feel valued as an employee-- I also feel like the company trusts its employees. 

The company culture at DocuSign is positive and collaborative. Both peers and management are helpful and friendly. There is still a start-up feel to the company culture, and employees are encouraged to bring fresh ideas to the table in a safe and supportive environment. There is a great balance between a relaxed atmosphere and professional drive (and results!), which encourages work-life balance and true talent development.

The company is also focused on diversity and inclusiveness for LGBTQ, immigrants, women, and people of color, and they take efforts to make sure the employee population reflects that and feels comfortable to be themselves. As someone who fits several of those categories, it's been great to know that my company cares about what struggles I might face as a minority--and that they walk the walk.

Lastly, the benefits are spectacular. The company's benefits are truly indicative of company that is investing in its employees and truly cares about their well-being. I feel lucky to be part of the DocuSign family, and look forward to growing with this great company!
cons: I honestly cannot think of a single thing!

headline: Definitely Top 5 Of Great Place to Work!
pros:
This is the BEST company that I've ever worked for so far!
-People here are multi-cultural and extremely welcome.
-Great office location with amazing physical working environment.
-High-tech and superb quality IT equipment.
-Great leadership from the senior management.
-Fantastic staff benefits and compensation.
-Generous spending on employee self-learning program.
-High flexibility of working hours or location (WFH or WeWork)
-Company is aiming high and strong for the business expansion
cons: Thus far I have not had any negative feedback and as this is the best Company I have ever worked for I would say no cons too.

headline: Proud to Work for DocuSign!
pros: I joined the team early this year and had high expectations based on Glassdoor reviews and other research I did on the company. I'm surprised to report that my expectations have been exceeded. DocuSign truly cares about its employees and provides an environment that encourages intellectual creativity, teamwork and innovation.
cons: I'm sure I could find a few cons if I was forced to, but why do that? Nobody or company is perfect, and the pros far outweigh any con I could think of.

headline: Product Manager
pros:
Get to work with lots of smart people who care about what we're doing
Company has grown fast and is clear market leader, but just scratching surface of huge opportunity
Good emphasis on work/life balance
Good pay/benefits.  Benefits have been improving fast
Emphasis on building diverse workplace
cons: Some internal processes can be a little slow

headline: Account Manager
pros:
-Public company - ESPP
-Benefits - ESPP, Matching 401K, Vacation Time & WFH policy
-Fast growing company with significant opportunity to continue transforming businesses and organizations in all sectors.
cons: -Due to it being a fast growing company, things do change quickly so you need to be adaptable and ready to learn

headline: A good place to be
pros:
Leader in category
Growing fast
Positive culture
Strong vision
Very high customer satisfaction
Experienced leadership
cons:
Fast growth = strained systems and processes for keeping up
Can serve literally any business globally = challenging to focus

headline: Genuinely a great place to work
pros: Lovely colleagues, an upbeat energy, good salary and benefits in a fast paced and fast growing company, never boring.
cons: Not really, so far so good.

headline: Best Employer I've Ever Had
pros: Fantastic Team Culture, Great Benefits, Seattle Office is in the Heart of Seattle, Work-Life Balance
cons: Large Work Volume, Processes/ Best Practices often are constructed and identified on the fly

headline: Great place to work!
pros: Very buzzing and vibrant place to work, people are great and there is always something new to learn
cons: Can be stressful at times due to the fast pace

headline: Fresh In The Door
pros:
Share based compensation, 
Free Food, 
Relaxed Atmosphere,
Young Workforce, 
Loads of Events.
cons:
International Travel,
Working Across Several Time Zones,
Tight deadlines.

headline: Customer Success Manager
pros:
- great place to work
- career opportunities
- very good product and vision

-
cons: - could have more snack and lunch

headline: More ups than downs, brilliant place to work!
pros:
DocuSign is great; disruptive (and evolving) platform, great executive staff, encouraging company culture and EXPONENTIALLY growing. 

The company offers many career paths for young folks coming into the workforce as well as great opportunities for those already established. We work with an innovative product, motivated peers and a customer base who truly appreciates our product. I have a DocuSign baggage tag and going through airports world wide I am constantly stopped by strangers who comment on it and then proceed to tell me their "DocuSign story." Now THAT is truely the most satisfying thing about working at DocuSign.
cons:
-The scale of growth is not without minor growing pains; lack of space at certain offices, semi-inflated management teams, lack of clear role responsibilities.  
-Despite the "global" stamp, the company still has a tendency to be very North American centric - both in the product and internally (but it is clearly getting better!). 
-Over the years it has become less of a "people" company and more of a "numbers" company, which is disappointing but inevitable.

headline: Great place to work, great benefits and great opportunities
pros: DocuSign is a great company to work for. They offer great benefits and really care about their employees. With rapid growth there is significant opportunity to grow with the business.
cons: With the rapid growth in the Sydney office we have run out of space and are split between the main office and a WeWork space. Plans to move in the early new year, but until then desk space is at a premium.

headline: DocuSign Company Review
pros: This is a wonderful company to work for.  The company really cares about employees, their well being and career development.
cons: Thus far I have not had any negative dealings and as this is the best Company I have ever worked for I would say no cons.

headline: I LOVE My Job
pros:
Here are the things I love most about DocuSign;
- Truly awesome people.  I work with smart, passionate, and caring people who I really like.
- Great product!  Every time I tell someone that I work at DocuSign they say "I LOVE DocuSign".
- Supportive leadership.  I know my boss believes in me and the team -- she's really great.
- Company growth.  With growth comes a lot of opportunity for my career.
- Good benefits.  Comprehensive benefits for me and my family.  Really glad DocuSign just added 401K matching.
- IMPACT.  DocuSign cares about the communities we work in and serve.  The Impact foundation work is an integral part of our values.
cons: With growth comes some pain.  Not all processes (and people) are scaling well.  This isn't unexpected, and will take some time to fully address, but leadership is aware and is working to improve things.

headline: Happy I am part of DocuSign
pros: Friends know you work for a great company. ESPP and soon 401k are the new benefits starting this year.
cons: Nothing that I can think of.

headline: Great place to work with great people
pros:
Great people, super modern and all online in the cloud, amazing products and leader who encourages to have and live a career, work-life balance possible, great snacks, events and office

Benefits: Bike to work scheme, healt, dental and life insurance, Gym discount, phone bill reimbursement, stocks...
cons: Non so far, will update by the end of the year

headline: Some Department-Specific 'Growing Pains', but Well Worth It
pros:
Investment in employees- I've been given abundant opportunities for growth & learning. Internal promotion is common and encouraged, especially for young employees. 
Transparent leadership- We have frequent chances to provide feedback for our leadership, anonymously or otherwise, which promotes clear communication across the team.
Work-Life Balance is highly encouraged.
cons: The sales org in particular has been going-through rapid growth over the last couple years, and with that we're experiencing some normal 'growing pains' associated with such expansion. Decisions and information in regards to promotion opportunities and team structure can sometimes come at the '11th hour'.

headline: DocuSign is a great place to work, and to be part of the digitalization era!
pros: Collaborative environment, high energy, life balance, great culture.  I came to DocuSign because it is a great culture to be part of, and because,  this is an exciting moment to be part of a company, like DocuSign, which enables companies to become truly digital.  The opportunity ahead of DocuSign is tremendous!
cons: I could not think of any cons so far!

headline: Great place to work
pros: Great benefits, Great people, Great work opportunities
cons: Still some growing pains evident as growing so fast. But doesn't impact the day to day work environment

headline: Best place I have ever worked!
pros: Really good group of co-workers,   good pay scale and bonus programs, stocked kitchen.
cons: If I have to say something than would be nice to have adjustable chairs at the workstations and all the desk should be standing desk.  There is a process to get a better chair but it is involved and slow.

headline: Excellent people, career path, and perks
pros:
I love that im surrounded by switched on, intelligent go-getters. It's an amazing team from many different backgrounds.

Free health plan, stocks, and 2 months paternity leave (or 6 mths for primary carer).
cons: Were growing so rapidly our office doesn't fit! Were moving to a new office in a few months, but until then the hot desk situation is annoying (get in early!)

headline: Best company to work for
pros:
Best Food
Best Working enviornment
Most important, best people.

Everyone is helpful here since the day I joined. My interview process was extremely smooth  but tough of course. For interview, Docusign takes care of all expenses.  
My manager is coolest manager in world. Trust me, I am not exaggerating.
cons: I cannot think of any cons

headline: Great Place to work - for sure
pros: Company is really growing up in terms of benefits, internal promotion pathes and focus on employee development.
cons: Growth it continuous - hold on to your seats!

headline: Great place to work. I love DocuSign!
pros: I´m very happy working at DocuSign. I had the chance to meet people all over the world and build a great product. I´m proud to work here. Great culture and people.
cons: Work with distributed teams can be tricky at times. It´s hard, but worth it.

headline: Customer Support Representative
pros: Good salary and work conditions
cons: It is hard to find anything negative

headline: Great place to work!
pros: The people who work at DocuSign are awesome! The work is exciting and the benefits are outstanding. I can't imagine working anywhere else!
cons: There are no major cons.

headline: Great place to work
pros: Great company, always worried about the environment and concern about the employee
cons: Nothing for me. Very happy to be part of this company.

headline: Solid Company, Subpar Culture
pros:
- Strong sales leaders and teams
- Great company growth
cons:
- Leadership is inconsistent at best so many operations are dysfunctional
- Culture on specific teams is very unfriendly and cold

headline: Great Company, Great People, Great Future
pros: The people at DocuSign are super smart, hyper focused, and super motivated. Everyone here is professional and nice to work with. Everyone is willing to go out of their way to help and ensure the continued success at DocuSign. We continue to grow as a company and with that growth there are plenty of opportunities for people to grow too, in their lives and careers.
cons: With our continued growth comes continued work. Things move at light speed here and sometimes it can be difficult to move that quickly for extended periods of time.

headline: Pragmatists honest review
pros:
The people here really try to live the values the company  espouses.  As a manager I can see the effort my peers in "middle management" try to be coaches, and really make an effort to address life balance, growth, diversity.   When there is conflict, it is healthy in that people have their hearts in what they think is best, vs a political agenda ( at least in Engineering ).  Life balance is great.  Folks have a focused 8 hour day and leave at reasonable times.  The realities of commuting and costs of living in the bay area is a reality we don't take for granted.  Working from home 1 to 2 days a week is not an exception, it's a norm.  If you are working late on a regular basis, then something has failed, it is not heroic.

we are in a high growth phase so with growth there is opportunity in many facets ( comp, career, learning )

I feel my most comfortable self here, which may be an artifact of my time in career as well, but for the most part I don't feel like I have to fit a certain persona to be accepted as compared to previous companies.
cons:
with growth can come some growing pains
we need to get better at not just doing things they way they were done before...for a relatively small company we have some slow legacy internal processes
Our Jira setup could be a lot more efficient.

headline: Lead Program Manager
pros: Great people, fun atmosphere, free foods, work life balance, startup opportunities. Unbelievable product in a market that is set to explode.
cons: Growing pains, unrefined systems, automation slow, core!

headline: DocuSign
pros:
- Great culture
- Fun people to work with
- recently added 401k benefits
- Company is growing so lots of opportunity
cons: Really no cons that are worth mentioning

headline: One of the best places I've worked
pros:
Interesting work
Beautiful and friendly work environment
Good benefits
Excellent community service program (DocuSign IMPACT)
Terrific leadership team
cons: Security is very important and tight, so naturally that slows down some business processes.

headline: Continued Personal Growth
pros:
- Amazing office and coworkers
- Clear company updates from upper management, Company All Hands meetings and Quarterly Town Halls.
- DocuSign is a product that has had a positive impact on the majority of people you speak/work with.
- General excitement for where DocuSign is and where the vision of System of Agreement will take us.
cons: - Team outings have declined since I started. Weekly happy hours turned to monthly and now rare.

headline: Legal Associate
pros: amazing company with great opportunities for employees to grow and learn
cons: Can be a pretty face paced environment, but management is very approachable for questions

headline: Associate Adoption Consultant
pros: Good Benefits, PTO and learning opportunities. Paternity leave policy recently updated. Coworkers are great.
cons: Middle management is poor, Lots of growing pains, Employees moving internally get shorted  in salary- promotes "boomerang" employment. Many people leave for much higher pay.

headline: Account Executive
pros:
-Benefits
-Great team environment
-Opportunity for growth within the Org
-Truly enjoy coming to work every day
cons: No cons that I can think of

headline: Great place to work!!!
pros:
Work, Teams, Technologies and Flexibility. Good balance of innovation and stability.
Great work culture, good snacks options, free lunch on couple of days of week.
cons: Gym membership missing and Commuter benefits/Bonus could be higher.

headline: Getting better & better
pros: Senior leadership good at getting the basics right - great benefits, promotion opportunities, work life balance, keeping the product competitive
cons: Compensation is fare, but not competitive to larger companies or start ups with equity gains

headline: Great Place to begin your Career in Sales
pros: DocuSign really invests in your development within the role. As a recent college graduate I found that DocuSign has taken the time to teach me the product, the necessary technology tools, and sales methodologies to allow me to be successful in the role. The culture is terrific at creating work life balance while keeping a positive competitive environment.
cons: Since DocuSign is still a relatively newer company there are constant adaptations and changes. Most are for the better but some have caused some unfair inequality between coworkers and opportunities. Most of these have been corrected but in the last year my career growth had been delayed due to some of the changes in the past.

headline: Best Job I've Gad
pros:
-Great culture and people
-Transparency into leadership 
-Great benefits/pay
-Free food at the offices
-More diversity than most tech companies (work in progress)
cons:
-Always will be growing pains when acquiring a company or going public (we've done both this year)
-Could have more flexible work from home policies
-Could use more snacks for gluten free or vegan people

headline: Fantastic Culture
pros: The culture being built around DocuSign is outstanding. Really enjoy working here and proud to talk about DocuSign outside of work to friends and family.
cons: Internal interview process is way too tedious. The hoops being put in place to advance internally are becoming more and more painstaking.

headline: Invests in their employees
pros: DocuSign invests heavily in creating a positive and productive work environment. It is evident that they want this to be the best place you've ever worked.
cons: Extremely competitive although this is to be expected at a successful tech company that recently went public. Pay could be higher especially in comparison to other tech companies in the area.

headline: Best place I ever worked
pros: Amazing company, with amazing people. It is very important to work for a company where you feel your opinion matters
cons: Still need some work in the management area, but there is a lot of improvement

headline: Best decision I've made so far in my career
pros:
I am so glad that I joined Docusign 2 years ago, it's one of the best decision I've ever made in my career (I've been working professionally for 10+ years). There too many Pros to list out:
- The company really listens to their employees. They have addressed the top feedbacks from our employee survey in the past year, which includes 401 K, education reimbursement program, and many more
- The best maternity leave benefit
- Excellent work life balance
- Free/healthy fruits/snacks/drinks all day long 
- Generous equity benefits
- We have a great product and our customer LOVES us
- The company has a long term vision of the system of agreement.
- Our C level executives (CEO, CIO, etc) comes out to company happy hour events regularly.
cons:
- Lack of job rotation program
- It's still a US centric company. The other regions/ markets outside of the US might felt disconnected at times.

headline: Love
pros:
I really enjoy working at DocuSign on the mobile team. Here are a list of the pros:
- Great work atmosphere.
- Really smart people all around who are really passionate about the product.
- Awesome learning opportunities. 
- Get to participate in developer conferences.
- Free lunch couple of days a week.
cons: I have been at the company for about 6 months, and I cannot think of any cons off the top of my head. One concern I had was no match toward 401-k but that is set to begin soon, so thank you, DocuSign.

headline: A+ Work Environment
pros: DocuSign offers a work environment that is both equally social and generous. Everyone is welcoming and there is a great sense of 'team.' Everyone is also very willing to lend a hand and offer their tips for success.
cons: The MDR role can get repetitive after a while, but the monthly compensation offered for excelling is definitely worth it.

headline: Great Place to Work!
pros: Great people, fun work environment, food and snacks (including avocados!), benefits (401k matching finally, commuter benefits, ESPP, full health, dental, vision), exciting work and vision for the company
cons: Hard to work with certain teams that are always "resource constrained" or working on a backlog, lower than market compensation for base salary

headline: Great place to work!
pros: Amazing people, amazing city, understandable product, and an excited client base! It is easy to work for a place that has a product that is easy to sell, but even better to work at a place where the product is something that is genuinely useful to a lot of people. The relationships I have made so far are the best personal take aways from the job, but I love everything about working here so far!
cons: The first few weeks can be at times very stressful, but management does a great job at training and preparation.

headline: Sr IT Business Analyst
pros:
Great Work
Good People
Amazing benifits - especially Dental/ESPP and 401K
Agile Teams
cons: Initiative Overload :) - Lots to be accomplished in very less time! But Again - That means lots to look forward to.

headline: Great Growing Company
pros:
- Lots of growth
- Great management
cons:
- Not many remote positions
- Need to update SF benefits (gym, health ect)

headline: Fast-moving company
pros: Growth, Speed, People, Perks, Offices
cons: Workload, Not in the center of Paris

headline: MDR
pros: Friendly work environment, and very bright future for the company
cons: complacency is dangerous here. The job becomes extremely comfortable which makes it tough to progress your career

headline: MDR
pros: The company culture here is by far the best of any company I've worked for. Everyone is so helpful and genuinely wants to see you succeed. Along with this, the work life balance makes coming into work everyday an absolutely pleasure.
cons: Only been here for 1 month, and have not seen any noticeable cons.

headline: Perfect Place to Start a Successful Sales Career
pros: Teams are highly competitive but very collaborative. Next career steps and goals are often discussed and management makes sure you are set up for doing your best work. Culture of a start up, perks of an blue chip.
cons: There is a pretty steep learning curve depending on what vertical/geo you are placed. There is always someone who has just been promoted from that role to tap advice from, though.

headline: SDET
pros: Great work culture,  competitive package, good stock options , good snacks options/ free lunch on couple of days of week
cons: growing pain, work space is small as there are hiring

headline: Sr. Director Customer Success
pros:
DocuSign it is a company with tremendous potential. Still a bit under 3,000 employees, but with a global footprint and rapid growth, is in a great position to hit a long stretch of expansion, from a product standpoint and geographically.
Culture is very open minded, really respectful of previous experience and welcoming. They know they have a strong market position, but take nothing for granted. Very focused on Customer Success as a key driver for growth.
cons: Growing pains like any other organization growing rapidly. I believe it can accommodate easily people coming from larger orgs or startups.

headline: Very cool place to work
pros:
good balance of innovation and stability, always open for improvements and better practices
your opinion will be taken into account
safe and comfortable environment
great diversity of talent and cultures
cons: since it is not a startup but a bigger company now, you might notice some signs of that corporate culture, which some might not to like

headline: Great place to learn
pros: The team is great, the coworkers are as well. Management really goes out of their way to help you get as much out of the internship as possible.
cons: The work gets repetitive and you are not incentivized to do better.

headline: Never looked back!
pros: They told me before I joined it was a great company, with a great product, great people.... and great customers  that love us.  It couldn't be more true.  The company and our market is full of opportunity. We have a great CEO who cascades a culture that people thrive in. What more could you ask for.!?
cons: The  fun never stops! It is like being at the Olympics every day - running from one event to the next. Be sure you are ready for the ride if you want it.

headline: Great Place
pros:
Cares about employees
Great benefits
Work life balance
cons: Slightly lower pay than surrounding top tech companies

headline: DocuSign Review
pros:
Great :
- People
- Salary
- Career Opportunity
- Benefits
- Culture
cons: Nothing really relevant to add here.

headline: Great Company to work with
pros: Benefits, Perks, so diverse, flexible working schedule and a lot of friendly, talented/smart people to work with.
cons: A little slow on interview scheduling ones the recruiter contacted you.  You just have to be patient to wait for the next call from the recruiter.  But it wouldn't hurt to follow up to get status or some feedback if you are really interested to work for a great company.

headline: because it feels like family and yet provides so many career opportunities
pros:
openness for new ideas.
freedom to say and do what you believe in
lots of opportunities to those who are willing to take them
cons: as a remote office, it sometimes hard to get HQ's attention.

headline: Finance
pros:
Work Life Balance
Flexible working hours
Relaxed Atmosphere
Educational assistance 
Location, central city centre
Free snacks
Open door policy with higher management
cons:
Some system issues 
Processes need to be locked down / implemented

headline: BD & Channel Director
pros:
- increasing maturity of offering (springcm acq)
- significant interest in building integrations to DS (from multinat to small ISV house)
- Internal employee facing systems are exceptional
cons: - teething issues of any young tech company

headline: MDR
pros: Fun culture, good pay, management seems to really care and it goes all the way up the chain.  Access to tools, training material, and info resources is unparalleled.
cons: I feel like there is some data issues internally that probably stem from the company changing how things are approached and growing at the rate it did but its certainly on the radar.  I guess other than that - if you strive in a no stress environment this may be a big adjustment.  There are a LOT of pieces all moving independently and relatively autonomously and it can be kind of overwhelming at times.

headline: Fantastic Place to Work
pros:
