Every two days you will see a new VP email of the usual demographic and never of any diversity or a woman.  It is a 650+ company that is ran like a 10 person start up.  No room for growth, hard to move around within the company...all about politics.

headline: DocuSign - glad I came here!
pros: Smart people, great product, industry leader, great location in downtown SF and Seattle.  Collaboration is strong.  Have not met one person yet who is not willing to help you and do what is best for the company.
cons: None that I can think of right now.  You have to want to be part of building a special company versus being at a company that is just in maintenance mode.

headline: Too many chiefs (VPs/C-level hires outnumber the doers), Good 'ol boy network
pros: Work environment - perks similar to other startups - great office space, good benefits, decent salary if you negotiate, some very smart people, product has potential
cons: Old school hierarchy rules - highly paid VPs abound, management skills lacking across the senior management team, typical tech sales driven culture.  The company lacks diversity on every single level but most predominately at the top.

headline: Fast Paced & Fun!
pros: Great earning potential, fast paced, industry leader in their space
cons: Low level management is a little green. Comp plan and account coverage plan changes constantly.

headline: Great Culture!
pros: This company has a really good culture. Good people and personalities make for some great friends. People are really welcoming and kind here.
cons: Growing fast. Be prepared to work hard. Lots of moving pieces and you have to be able to adapt to growing pains. Top heavy, but preparing for growth.

headline: Lower sales quotas!
pros:
Revolutionary product and market leader. 

I'd recommend DocuSign to a friend, but not if they are applying for a sales role.
cons: I agree with the review from another Corporate Account Executive on Dec 6, 2013 - the sales quotas are very unreasonable (talented sales reps are only getting 60% to quota), it's a very bad comp plan, and nobody making any money except for the lucky few who sell to Banks and Credit Unions and to Wealth Management. You are told you will make $60,000 in base (which you do) and $60 in commission, but in reality, you will make 1/3 of that commission. And from what I can tell, despite the majority of reps (and there are many talented Account Executives) not hitting quota, it won't be lowered anytime soon.

headline: Lots of wasted talent, and lots of over rated talent, lot of infighting and politics, adds up to lots of dysfunction
pros: eSignature is a great viral market
cons: Those who have been in the trenches for years at DocuSign are left behind with every new VP hire. Honesty is a bad word. When it came time to pay or to admit mistakes, it became time to present a new comp plan, or shown the door. The sales management of the company is poor at best, the old line sales team and a few new commers are keeping the place going.

headline: Not bad
pros: The compensation is good. Most of the people I worked with are great. The office has a good environment, provides plenty of snacks and drinks with a nice view of the bay bridge.
cons: There was no work/life balance for me personally. It's what you can expect from a startup. I usually work till 11pm before I had to leave to catch my ride home. The company had suck the life out of me.

headline: CEO is a greedy jerk! DocuSign has More VPs than a Banana Republic
pros: Great coworkers and technology in a fun space.
cons:
Glassdoor has jumped the skark, naming this a best company to work. CEO is killing company with his hubris. He keeps hiring VPs, count is over 60. For a company this size? Nobody knows what the VPs do, everyone thinks its a big, sad joke. 

All VP hires are men, by the way. Dude does not have a clue, think he's the Master of the Universe. His VPs keep him from reality, not one has any balls. Employees are underpaid and overworked. Entire dept quit together last month. Never seen that before. And so have many long time employees and top sales performers. 

Never worked at a place where everyone is so miserable, waiting for their exit. This is not how the company was a few years ago. CEO is trying to blend old school management at say GE, IBM, with Valley culture, and copying only the worst aspects of each one. He expects employees to work around the clock like other startups. But without a stake in the company or the benefits and perks that are standard here in the Valley.

Too stupid to realize that happy employees make great companies. Too much misery can take a company down, however great your technology.

headline: Fast-growing and Passionate
pros: Everyone really cares and is extremely talented and good at their jobs. People are recognized and appreciative for their contributions. Under-performers are not left to hang around and bring everybody down.
cons: Things get really busy and sometimes unfocused, but everyone's heart seems in the right place.

headline: Innovation and Collaboration
pros:
Working at DocuSign is like being part of a big family.  Everyone cares about your opinion and experience.  The Team listens when you talk, corrects you when you’re wrong and builds you up to make everyone successful.

I love white boarding new ideas with the CTO, hanging out with the Dev and ops teams.  We have a great and knowledgeable CS team.
cons: There is a lot to do at DocuSign.  We have so many great ideas to implement we’re never board.  I’d like to move faster there just isn’t enough time.

headline: Great culture, sound business
pros:
You make a real difference in the world
It's a sound, revenue based business that has gone through ups and downs
Innovative technology, energized leadership
cons: There is too much opportunity everywhere.  This is a place where you need to work hard and relentlessly prioritize.

headline: Do not work here (in Sales) unless you are truly desperate
pros: some nice people, product is ok, free drinks a few free snacks
cons: bad middle management, you are truly just a number here, paranoid management only concern is "perception" and putting on a good show for boss (example: middle managers telling salespeople to walk briskly down the halls), extreme micro-management, TINY cubes, unreasonable sales quotas, very bad comp plan, nobody making any money except for the lucky few who sell to Banks and Credit Unions and to Wealth Management - if you aren't in one of these verticals (and you won't be) this is truly a dead-end, don't pay for cell phone but want you connected 24/7, bad benefit package, don't match 401k, have managed to drain all the fun out of the workplace.

headline: Hang on for the ride!
pros: I get to work with some of the smartest people i've ever met, great team environment, fun culture, fantastic product and customers love it!
cons: Like all fast growing companies, a lot of the processes are undefined and too much of the knowledge is tribal knowledge.

headline: Faster than a speeding bullet!
pros: Great product that is fun to sell and highly demanded.  Amazing people to work with and a strong emphasis on company culture.  Everyone from senior leadership on down to the newest DocuSign employees collaborate well together to achieve a common goal.
cons: Onboarding and training of new employees needs improvement.  This is crucial for a company that is growing as fast as DocuSign is.

headline: A Hot Mess
pros: Very good product. Good Customer Base
cons:
The title really tells the story. The product is very hot but the company is very poorly managed and poorly run. They are way overstaffed in marketing especially when they outsource so much. Product development is wasting its time on connectors that are pretty useless (Sugar, MS CRM, etc). If you join this company as an Account Executive, you're making a big mistake. 70% of the AEs are not making their numbers. The only ones that are in the financial services vertical and those "guys" have been protected for years. Look on the salaries tab on glassdoor...I assure it's very accurate. Seattle and San Francisco are not cheap cities and making that in a market where other companies will pay you much better seems stupid to go here. I was sold on how much money I was going to make a DocuSign and now realize it was a lie. 

Sales Management is immature and inexperienced. Everyone in Marketing is either a Director or a Manager and most of them have no direct reports. 

Previous reviews that use the words "Frat House" and lack of "Integrity" are accurate

headline: Explosively growing DocuSign family with endless career paths
pros: Collaborative, Open Door Policy, Honest Communication, Mentors, Fun, Energetic, Growth, Future, Career Path, Tech Experience, DocuSign "Family" Culture, Work Hard Play Hard, Market Share to be gained, Endless customer base, The Next Microsoft/Google
cons: Stretched thin management, tunnel vision growth focus, often self managed

headline: The future
pros: great people, if environment is what you are looking for you will be stretched and establish great relationships both internally and externally with clients
cons: people cant buy fast enough, the technology of DocuSign is absolutely game changing and it is just a matter of market  adoption, DocuSign is inevitable

headline: Don't be fooled, this Company has NO integrity
pros: Nice views in both offices, free drinks, big name recognition for now. Solid industry partners make the career potential to jump ship not too bad.
cons: High profile employees has been leaving en masse lately, and for good reason. The company broke their word and their contract for my whole team and didn't pay out the agreed upon compensation. What's worse is they tried to hide it. Only after multiple people complained about it did they issue a statement. Complete lack of integrity and honesty from management. Also, it's just a matter of time before e-signature is just another spell check and is offered by other major companies out there as a free feature in a larger suite of products.

headline: Leader in the industry . . .
pros: Platform is the standard in the e-signature space; personnel are some of the best and brightest in their respective fields.
cons: As with any emerging start-up, change was a constant; leadership changed often in the early days of the organization; non-leadership personnel were often viewed as commodities.

headline: Market Development Rep
pros: Culture, Management, exciting  great employees
cons: I don't have any cons.

headline: All review Made up- Tech guys be aware never Jump into mess- Easy to hire, easy to fire
pros: You will get hired easily if you know some one.
cons: It is a big mess. people in Tech are very over smart, change their strategy next min.

headline: Exciting times at DocuSign!
pros: Working at DocuSign has been a tremendous experience. The people are fantastic, the product is awesome, and even greater things are on the horizon.
cons: Hyper-growth always creates growing pains.

headline: To the moon
author_position: Leiter Technik Verdichter / Mitglied der Geschäftsleitung
pros: I've been at DocuSign for a few years now and it's been nothing short of a great ride.  This is a great company with fast growth and it's exciting to be part of something special.  Very excited for our company to take it to the next level and see the outcome.
cons: A fast growing company like this has growing pains as we are expanding rapidly but this isn't unlike any other company with the same growth.  We sometimes get curve balls but it's up to us as employees to submit feedback and correct the course.

headline: The Fun and Excitement of HyperGrowth
pros: The hyper growth DocuSign has seen over the past 4-5 years has created an amazing environment of top talent, entrepreneurial spirit and unparalleled personal growth opportunities.
cons: With the above mentioned growth, systems are becoming antiquated quickly, scalability is a bit of challenge, however this is known to be part of the excitement of the velocity we are moving as an organization.

headline: Great experience at a fast paced company
pros: Great organization with passionate leadership. The product is simple to understand and has a big impact to companies all over the world. Fast paced organization with high rate of growth year over year make this an exciting organization to work for.
cons: With an organization growing as fast as this, sometimes there can be smaller initiatives that fall in between cracks. Can have a tendency to hire outside of company vs promotion from within. All in all these are things that come along with a fast paced company.

headline: A Place for Growth
pros:
I have worked here two years, and was promoted with in 8 months. I came in knowing very little, if anything at all about sales. Now, I consider myself well versed in sales due to the mentoring of junior management and support from my colleagues.

 DocuSign is a hot company and is growing fast. The company invests in the sales team with trainings, weekly webinars, speakers and other resources. Sales personnel get to travel all over the country, on the company dime, to attend the elite conferences. DocuSign also rewards success handsomely with exotic trips and expensive SPIFFs. 

For anyone that wants to be apart of a growing, fast paced environment and is burning to grow and succeed, DocuSign is the quintessential choice of employment.
cons: Annual conference is too long.

headline: Rocket ship!
pros:
Selling a disruptive technology and being the market leaders is amazing fun!  

Incredible market opportunity with relatively untapped potential.  Greenfield opportunities everywhere with most large corporate organizations having yet to move to straight through processing.  

Paper processes are dying  and DocuSign is in the perfect position to capture the business that results from converting over.  Solutions have a very real and quantifiable ROI which makes building a business case for conversion relatively simple.

Filled with highly capable individuals and brings constant opportunities for professional development.  Intense environment that demands a lot but certainly rewards the effort!
cons:
Hyper growth brings growing pains.  Still working out the processes that will allow the business to scale effectively.  Investments are being made actively to help with these growing pains but there is still a lot of opportunity to accelerate this.  

Seems to be a lot of investment in executive leadership but not enough focus on bringing in more people to help execute.  Definitely room for more front line team members to help plow through the growing opportunity and workload.

headline: Fabulous place to be....
pros: The energy of the company is tremendous and very impressive.  There are a lot of very passionate people that work here.  The direction of the company is just as good. Being the market leader is an awesome place to be.  The team I get to work on is a very fun bunch that loves their jobs and loves to create qualify software solutions.  There are a ton of enticing projects to work on.  And, the view from the current Seattle office is likely unmatched!
cons: Like any company with a (relatively) small technology staff, there is lots to do.  Like any company, miskes are made.  The measure of that company is how you deal with the mistake and if you repeat the mistake down the road.

headline: Best Job I have ever worked at!!
pros: It has been the most rewarding experience working at DocuSign because of my manager, team, and overall work environment.  I not only feel supported, but also valued, as being a member of my sales team.  Everyday there is something new to expect and it only gets better as we grow and scale.
cons: As we grow so quickly we need to put more process in place, but I would take fast growth and worry about process later!

headline: Put in the effort, reap the rewards.
pros: Plenty of room for professional growth.  A lot of room to differentiate and get noticed.  Great culture.  Hard working, helpful, and friendly employees.  Solid product you can feel good about selling.
cons: Demanding work.  Management expects a lot, but at least doesn't breath down your neck.  That said, good compensation when you meet your goals.

headline: Huge potential and extraordinary sales environment!
pros: Huge market, committed and energetic sales leadership, amazing colleagues and very strong compensation.  The product is constantly improving and career opportunities present themselves fairly regularly.  I'd recommend the company to anyone looking for a high performance, achievement-oriented and very fun environment.
cons: Other than pricey downtown parking rates and the typical challenges that come along with a high growth company, I can't say I can add too much to the list of cons.

headline: Challenging, Rewarding, and Enjoyable
pros: DocuSign is a truly great place to work, populated by talented people who work hard but have fun doing so. There is strong leadership in all parts of the business and the company has evolved its career path model to create opportunities for internal promotions that reward top performers. From a sales perspective the product is market leading, the customer growth is strong, and the market opportunity spans company size and industry. There are ample resources made available to drive sales results, including technology tools (LinkedIn, Eloqua, etc.), sales support (Sales Engineers, Managers, product experts, legal), and materials (presentations, demo's, case studies, etc.). It is a company designed to aid in goal achievement.
cons: The biggest cons of the company are a result of accelerated growth and expectations. The company is growing and moving fast, and that can lead to a few cut corners or missed opportunities.

headline: DocuSign is a game changer for any business!
pros: The people are passionate, intelligent and creative.  The product is fun to sell and has an immediate impact on their business.  Good ideas, hard work, and sales professionalism are always rewarded.
cons: Parking is expensive.  No other cons.

headline: Love my job
pros:
It's all about the people.  Great people to work with, plenty of laughs & fun, and plenty of great stuff getting accomplished.  Supportive & friendly teammates & managers.

DocuSign experience & connections will be great for future opportunities.

Pre-IPO stock options could be lucrative.
cons: Merely good benefits, rather than great.  That should improve as company matures.

headline: Horrible experience!
pros: Nothing good to mention for pros.
cons: Extremely arrogant people!!!!! New joiners are treated badly & expect them to work with absolutely no direction. Horrible work culture.

headline: Changing the world one contract at a time
pros: DocuSign is driving real innovation in the document-centric marketplace and has clearly become the market leader.  Management is very focused on market-share growth and increasing revenue.  the company is poised to be a very successful IPO at some point in the future.  They are continuing to grow with external hires but also promote from within.
cons: Change is constant and pressure to perform is very high.

headline: Childs Play
pros: Come on.....  not much to note on the pros side.... oh maybe the benefits and the view.  Oh, and a lot of friendly and enjoyable co-workers.
cons: Childish and inexperienced leadership, arrogant beyond imagination, boring product, sales are actually more p.o. takers (not a hard product to sell and not very strategic.... definitely not a solution sale).   If you are "child" with little ambition, you may actually enjoy DocuSign.  This can kill your career growth if you are hoping to get into a true technology sales role after leaving DocuSign -- I don't think true technology companies will consider the "telesales" experience very transferable in the marketplace… Not a good stepping stone.

headline: Culture fallout - management ego at fault, no long term vision
pros: Some of the most steller, hard working sales people I've seen in this industry. I've learned so much from the individual mentors that made this place amazing when they were still a young company.
cons:
Management. Lies.

I was there when there was only about 70 employees. Things were real. People worked hard. Company flourished. New management settles in, culture shifts - HQ moves to SF, no one knows. Sales teams get decimated... and it goes on and on. So many good people were pushed out only to be replaced with a bunch of people with no relavant skills. Just buddies from previous companies parachuting in to ruin families. Personally, I try to give my two weeks notice and was simply pushed out - got ripped off in payment that was due. Etc. When you have former employees suing you, this clearly isn't the right place to be at.

I've had people I don't even know find me and call me on my phone, long after I left. Literally crying about how unfair their manager was treating them.

The product and some people are really hard working here, but all the politics and power struggle between the management team has ripped this place apart.

headline: No sales leadership
pros: Great product, many great people
cons: A complete lack of sales leadership.  Reps do things that are clearly not in the best interest of the company, just of their sales goals, and this is constantly supported by Inside Sales management, to the detriment of the company and DocuSign Partners.

headline: You too can be a Director @ DocuSign!
pros: Decent product, and likely a bright future for the Saas company, given the share of the eSignature market it currently owns.
cons: DocuSign has more people with "Director" titles that don't actually direct anyone (as in, zero direct reports) or anything than any place I've ever seen.  This place is truly cronyism at its finest.  For everyone else, it's long hours and low pay.  Unless you worked at Lexis Nexis in a former life (and therefore automatically qualify for a big title and $$$ at DocuSign) don't waste your time...work somewhere else where your level of experience and contribution actually correlate to your title and comp.  Terrible benefits, no 401k match.

headline: Big time fail.
pros:
Some of the most talented salespeople in the industry.
Great technology. 
Team oriented culture.
cons: This is not a work-life balance company. Different teams within the same role have very different experiences. Micromanagement at it's worst, mandatory 50 hrs a week in the office and call stats reported daily. It's a boiler room mentality. Quotas are unachievable and keep going up. This is a whale hunting role not a transactional sales environment which takes at least a year to ramp up your pipeline. You need the big deals to hit your quota, but large opportunities get poached by Enterprise reps. Certain AE teams receive consistent leads, others fend for themselves and cold call to survive. Terrible morale and low compensation.

headline: Sales
pros: Product, its absolutely top of the line.  Never having to defend the solution you sell means the world.  Company atmosphere is also top of the class.  Great people, great attitude, very exciting environment and great growth year over year.
cons: Rapidly changing environment can be hard to keep up with.

headline: Sales oriented organization with a great group of people.  Love this company!
pros: It's a great environment to come to work everyday, and the people are easy to work with.  The management is fair and challenging.  There's always something to learn.
cons: DocuSign requires you to push your knowledge and limits in order to be a part of something great.  It's not easy, but it's fun.

headline: Fast paced and growing rapidly
pros:
Good people in engineering
Dedicated and hardworking team
Fast paced engaging work
Work from home options
Team building events often
Nice facilities
cons: Hpyergrowth pains can be challenging

headline: Fantastic Company with amazing opportunity and culture
pros: Tremendous Growth and Momentum. Earning potential is unlimited and there is great opportunity for career growth
cons: young company so change is inevitable.

headline: Couldn't be happier w/ my choice to join Docusign!!!
pros: Incredibly smart and supportive leadership team, amazing technology that is just scratching the surface of its impact in the world, fun hardworking culture leads to great compensation results!!!  May sound like a canned review as Pros, but I mean every bit of it!!!
cons: I'll tell you when i find something of consequence.  If you find a con, leadership is always willing to listen to make things better.

headline: Incredible highs that don't compensate for the lows
pros:
Disruptive product and smart, passionate team members can make for a compelling brand and company. 

Customers love DocuSign and how it has improved their life - the impact is real for both enterprise and consumers.
cons:
Very political culture with a fixed mindset of what employees are capable of. Lack of direct feedback can make it difficult to know what key stakeholders actually think of projects. 

Tendency to marginalize talent deemed too threatening to directors.

headline: Grt growth right now.
pros: Growth, great culture, great compensation.
cons: Long hours, Turnover, Executive team turnover can cause problems.

headline: Hard working, fast growing
pros: DocuSign has a lot of good, smart people and is a growing company. There are lots of opportunities to make a difference.
cons: Rapid growth has hurt communication, especially communication between different departments, making work more difficult. There are problems with people following up on items.

headline: Paranoid
pros: This company has very strong products.
cons: The employees are constantly put in situations which make the culture paranoid.   They are very controlling and management does not work together well.   There are too many chiefs and not enough indians in the company.   Most employees are dissatisfied with their management.  Although, the employees do get along well with each other.

headline: Self-focused, inept leadership hindered those really making the company succeed.
pros: Flexible hours, free beverages, nice view, some very nice, hard working people, near the bus, reimbursements for parking or bus passes.
cons: Cronyism at it's finest --  doesn't matter what you know, just who you know;  self focused, arrogant and mostly inept new leadership; failure to tell the truth about shifting corporate headquarters to San Francisco and pretending employees are to dumb to figure it out;  new "management" dismantled what actually made the company succeed and is now struggling to put the pieces back -- similar to what they destroyed; secretive, back stabbing. Not a culture that most people would thrive in for very long.

headline: Growing too fast for itself
pros:
Passionate, smart people
Awesome product you can feel good about making, promoting, selling
Development infrastructure
Great location
Every day is not the same
cons:
Chaos and confusion produced by being in a fast growth mode
Long hours and a lack of work life balance

headline: Engaging people to work with and clear path to success
pros: High-quality engineering team members, great office views, high growth company. Overall it has been a pleasure to work here.
cons: There are no real big downsides, just the normal problems associated with a growing company: improving space, separating teams with different needs, communication from top leaders to new people, etc.
